content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: SEENDTC
      operator: has_next_corresponding_record
      value: SESTDTC
      within: USUBJID
      ordering: SESEQ
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0207
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error where SEENDTC is not equal to SESTDTC of the next element.
Outcome:
  Message: SEENDTC is not equal to SESTDTC of the next element.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0207
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Since there are, by definition, no gaps between Elements,
                  the value of SEENDTC for one Element will always be the same as
                  the value of SESTDTC for the next Element.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 8
                Section: '5.3'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SE

json.Description: Trigger error where SEENDTC is not equal to SESTDTC of the next element.

Outcome.Message: SEENDTC is not equal to SESTDTC of the next element.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Since there are, by definition, no gaps between Elements, the value of SEENDTC for one Element will always be the same as the value of SESTDTC for the next Element.
